00025 
00026 #ifndef BITVECTOR_H
00027 #define BITVECTOR_H
00028 
00029 //
00030 // Packed bit vector
00031 //
00032 class BitVector {
00033 public:
00034     BitVector()
00035     {
00036         m_bits  = 0;
00037         m_bytes = 0;
00038         m_allTrue = 0;
00039         m_vector = NULL;
00040     }
00041 
00042     ~BitVector() { clear(); }
00043 
00044     // number of bits
00045     uint32 size() const { return m_bits; }
00046 
00047     // is it empty?
00048     bool empty() const { return m_bits == 0; }
00049 
00050     // get bit at index
00051     bool get(uint32 idx) const
00052     {
00053         if (idx >= m_bits) {
00054             wxFAIL;
00055             return false;
00056         }
00057         return (m_vector[idx / 8] & s_posMask[idx & 7]) != 0;
00058     }
00059 
00060     // set bit at index
00061     void set(uint32 idx, bool value)
00062     {
00063         if (idx >= m_bits) {
00064             wxFAIL;
00065             return;
00066         }
00067         uint32 bidx = idx / 8;
00068         if (value) {
00069             m_vector[bidx] = m_vector[bidx] | s_posMask[idx & 7];
00070             // If it was not all true before, then we don't know now.
00071             if (m_allTrue == 0) {
00072                 m_allTrue = 2;
00073             }
00074         } else {
00075             m_vector[bidx] = m_vector[bidx] & s_negMask[idx & 7];
00076             m_allTrue = 0;
00077         }
00078     }
00079 
00080     // set number of bits to zero and free memory
00081     void clear()
00082     {
00083         m_bits  = 0;
00084         m_bytes = 0;
00085         m_allTrue = 0;
00086         delete[] m_vector;
00087         m_vector = NULL;
00088     }
00089 
00090     // set number of bits and initialize them with value
00091     void setsize(uint32 newsize, bool value)
00092     {
00093         if (newsize == 0) {
00094             clear();
00095             return;
00096         }
00097         m_bits = newsize;
00098         m_bytes = newsize / 8;
00099         if (newsize & 7) {
00100             m_bytes++;
00101         }
00102         delete[] m_vector;
00103         m_vector = new uint8[m_bytes];
00104         memset(m_vector, value ? 0xFF : 0, m_bytes);
00105         m_allTrue = value ? 1 : 0;
00106     }
00107 
00108     // are all bits true ?
00109     bool AllTrue() const
00110     {
00111         if (m_allTrue == 2) {
00112             // don't know, have to check
00113             bool foundFalse = false;
00114             uint32 lastByte = m_bytes;
00115             if (m_bits & 7) {
00116                 // uneven: check bits of last byte individually
00117                 lastByte--;
00118                 for (uint32 i = m_bits & 0xfffffff8; !foundFalse && i < m_bits; i++) {
00119                     foundFalse = !get(i);
00120                 }
00121             }
00122             // check bytewise
00123             for (uint32 i = 0; !foundFalse && i < lastByte; i++) {
00124                 foundFalse = m_vector[i] != 0xff;
00125             }
00126             // This is really just a caching of information, 
00127             // so m_allTrue is mutable and AllTrue() still const.
00128             m_allTrue = foundFalse ? 0 : 1;
00129         }
00130         return m_allTrue == 1;
00131     }
00132 
00133     // set all bits to true
00134     void SetAllTrue() { if (m_bytes) { memset(m_vector, 0xFF, m_bytes); } }
00135 
00136     // handling of the internal buffer (for EC)
00137     // get size
00138     uint32 SizeBuffer() const { return m_bytes; }
00139     // get buffer
00140     const void* GetBuffer() const { return m_vector; }
00141     // set buffer
00142     void SetBuffer(const void* src) { memcpy(m_vector, src, m_bytes); m_allTrue = 2; }
00143 
00144 private:
00145     uint32  m_bits;         // number of bits
00146     uint32  m_bytes;        // number of bytes in the vector
00147     uint8 * m_vector;       // the storage
00148     mutable uint8 m_allTrue;// All true ? 0: no  1: yes  2: don't know
00149     static const uint8 s_posMask[]; // = {0x01, 0x02, 0x04, 0x08, 0x10, 0x20, 0x40, 0x80}; implemented in OtherFunctions.cpp
00150     static const uint8 s_negMask[]; // = {0xFE, 0xFD, 0xFB, 0xF7, 0xEF, 0xDF, 0xBF, 0x7F};
00151 };
00152 
00153 #endif
Generated on 4 Dec 2014 for aMule by  1.6.1
